intro: Serapias mauretanica, commonly known as the Mauretanian sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with a prominent central boss. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Its leaves are basal and linear, while its stems are often unbranched. Serapias mauretanica is a perennial species that blooms in spring and is often found in coastal and inland dunes.
